title: How to cite the Oxford English dictionary MLA - Quora

response.answer_text: You cite by the specific word in the parenthetical citation. So, if you were using the OED definition of knight it would look like this: (“knight”). No page number, as it’s already alphabetized. Then, in the Works Cited entries on your last page, you will need one entry for each word’s definition you cite from the OED. I’m assuming you are using the online version rather than the 24-volume print version, so a sample OED entry in the Works Cited might look like this, but double-spaced and with hanging indentation: "Filibuster." Oxford English Dictionary, Oxford University Press, 2019, http://oed.com/view/Entry/70179?redirectedFrom=fillibuster#eid. Accessed 27 July 2019.
